events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection causing visible damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and accident details.
An agent specializing in vehicle collision cases was assigned promptly to handle the investigation process.
The claimant was sent an acknowledgment notice confirming the receipt and opening of their auto accident claim.
The claimant was requested to provide photos of the damaged vehicle and the police accident report to proceed.
All requested documents including photos and official police report were submitted by the claimant on schedule.
The investigation team began examining vehicle damages and interviewing witnesses to determine fault.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damages were consistent with reported accident.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover all repair costs and rental car expenses during repair period.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely handling and clear communication throughout the process.
The claim approval was formally issued, confirming full coverage of damages as per policy terms.
Payment for damages and related expenses was successfully transferred to the claimantâ€™s bank account.
The claim was officially closed after successful settlement and no further issues from the claimant.
The case file was archived in the records system for future reference and compliance auditing.
